profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-11-05T10:25-0500

did.unittitle: Mary Lou Estabrook Photographs

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: The collection documents the photographic work of Mary Lou Estabrook in her capacity as Associate Editor and Chief Photographer of the Lakeville Journal for the period 1971-1986. Also included is photographic work made from 1986-2004 for personal use and for publication in the Lakeville Journal. Contains contact sheets, negatives, proofs and digital prints predominantly black and white with some color. Towns in Northwest Connecticut are covered including landscapes, events and activities, landmarks and architecture. Photographs documenting national and international trips are also included and may have appeared in the newspaper.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Contact sheets and negatives are arranged by date and correspond with the appearance of photographs in the Lakeville Journal. The Lakeville Journal can be used as an index to the photographic material.

processinfo.head: Processing Information/Conservation
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Never dull : from Washington editor and foreign correspondent to country publisher / Robert H. Estabrook. Lanham, Md. : Hamilton Books, c2005. Dodd call number: C11189

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Born August 14, 1920 in Chicago, Illinois, Mary Lou (Stewart) Estabrook was associate publisher and chief photographer of The Lakeville Journal from 1971 through 1986. She was the wife of Robert H. Estabrook who was the Washington Post's editorial page editor from 1953 to 1971. Mary Lou and Robert published The Lakeville Journal from 1971 to 1986. In 1990, Mary Lou was awarded a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in photography with highest distinction from Charter Oak College in Connecticut. She was a member of the Housatonic Camera Club. Mary Lou's scenic photographs had a regular spot on the editorial page of The Lakeville Journal and her pictures throughout the paper won many prizes. She traveled with Robert on some of his trips as a foreign correspondent and her photographs accompanied his text about their travels in The Lakeville Journal. Mary Lou's photographs have also appeared in Yankee Magazine, The New York Times, Newsday, The Hartford Courant and the Waterbury Republican. Mary Lou Estabrook died May 3, 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the photographic work of Mary Lou Estabrook in her capacity as Associate Editor and Chief Photographer of the Lakeville Journal for the period 1971-1986. Also included is photographic work made from 1986-2004 for personal use and for publication in the Lakeville Journal. Contains contact sheets, negatives, proofs and digital prints predominantly black and white with some color. Towns in northwest Connecticut are covered including landscapes, events and activities, landmarks and architecture. Photographs documenting national and international trips are also included and may have appeared in the newspaper.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Mary Lou Estabrook Photographs. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The donor has assigned the copyright to the Archives. Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from the University of Connecticut Libraries.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.
